item.title: Laura VanArendonk add a quote by Brooke Foss Westcott
item.description: "Indeed taking all the evidence together, it is not too much to say that there is no single historic incident better or more variously supported than the Resurrection of Christ. Nothing but the antecedent assumption that it must be false could have suggested the idea of deficiency in the proof of it." -- Brooke Foss Westcott

item.title: Laura VanArendonk add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description:
"Conventionality is not morality. Self-righteousness is not religion. To attack the first is not to assail the last. To pluck the mask from the face of the Pharisee, is not to lift an impious hand to the Crown of Thorns.
These things and deeds are diametrically opposed: they are as distinct as is vice from virtue. Men too often confound them: they should not be confounded: appearance should not be mistaken for truth; narrow human doctrines, that only tend to elate and magnify a few, should not be substituted for the world-redeeming creed of Christ. There is – I repeat it – a difference; and it is a good, and not a bad action to mark broadly and clearly the line of separation between them." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Laura VanArendonk add a quote by Maimonides
item.description: "Truth does not become more true by virtue of the fact that the entire world agrees with it, nor less so even if the whole world disagrees with it." -- Maimonides

item.title: Laura VanArendonk add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Laura VanArendonk add a quote by Robin Hobb
item.description: "A woman of many talents. And intelligent, too. He'd probably have to kill her soon." -- Robin Hobb

item.title: Laura VanArendonk add a quote by St. Teresa of Avila
item.description: "Untilled ground, however rich, will bring forth thistles and thorns; so also the mind of man." -- St. Teresa of Avila

item.title: Laura VanArendonk add a quote by Diana Wynne Jones
item.description: "In the land of Ingary where such things as seven-league boots and cloaks of invisibility really exist, it is quite a misfortune to be born the eldest of the three. Everyone knows you are the one who will fail first, and worst, if the three of you set out to seek your fortunes." -- Diana Wynne Jones

item.title: Laura VanArendonk add a quote by Diana Wynne Jones
item.description: "I think we ought to live happily ever after." -- Diana Wynne Jones

item.title: Laura VanArendonk add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Laura VanArendonk add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Write about what really interests you, whether it is real things or imaginary things, and nothing else." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Laura VanArendonk add a quote by Walter Farley
item.description: "His mane was like a crest, mounting, then falling low. His neck was long and slender, and arched to the small, savagely beautiful head. The head was that of the wildest of all wild creatures- a stallion born wild- and it was beautiful, savage, splendid. A stallion with a wonderful physical perfection that matched his savage, ruthless spirit." -- Walter Farley

item.title: Laura VanArendonk add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde
